intro: Origanum akhdarense, commonly known as Armenian oregano, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Eastern Mediterranean. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and small, pale blue or violet flowers. Its leaves are fragrant and used in traditional cuisine and herbal medicine. Origanum akhdarense thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or limestone habitats.
